jtxt.emulator.util.image

Interface ColorSamplingStrategy

  • Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ColorSamplingStrategy
    Defines the way in which color information should be preserved when converting from the source image to the output. Different sampling strategies have implementations that are provided as a part of this interface.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ColorSamplingStrategy AVG
      The values of the pixels in the region being sampled are averaged together to determine output color.
      static ColorSamplingStrategy MODAL
      Samples an image such that each pixel of the output is equal to the most frequently occurring color in the region of the source image that is being sampled.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int sample(int[][] colors)
      Given a region of pixels (which we will refer to as a chunk), this method should return a color that appropriately represents the colors in that chunk.

    • Field Detail

      • MODAL

        static final ColorSamplingStrategy MODAL
        Samples an image such that each pixel of the output is equal to the most frequently occurring color in the region of the source image that is being sampled. This strategy gives the best results for images that have many colors, but may lead to loss of detail in the output.

      • AVG

        static final ColorSamplingStrategy AVG
        The values of the pixels in the region being sampled are averaged together to determine output color. This strategy usually gives better results for images that have very few colors and tends to preserve details in the output.

    • Method Detail

      • sample

        int sample(int[][] colors)
        Given a region of pixels (which we will refer to as a chunk), this method should return a color that appropriately represents the colors in that chunk. An image that is constructed from these samples should retain some level of resemblance to the original image.
        Parameters:
        colors - The two-dimensional array of colors in the region that is being sampled, where a pixel at (x, y) is in the array at the indices colors[y][x].
        Returns:
        An integer between 0-255 that represents the sampled color of this chunk of the image.
